title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned only for the correct implicit differentiation of 6xy=2+ y 3 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@414D@ Responses may use alternative notations for dy dx , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D89@ such as y ′ . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWG5bGbauaacaGGUaaaaa@3AB8@

The second point cannot be earned without the first point.

It is sufficient to present 2y= dy dx ( y 2 −2x) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4589@ to earn the second point, provided there are no subsequent errors.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned with any of 2y=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaamyEaiabg2da9iaaicdacaGGSaaaaa@3D26@ y=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG5bGaeyypa0JaaGimaiaacYcaaaa@3C6A@ dy dx =0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA6@ dy dx =0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA6@ dy=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGKbGaamyEaiabg2da9iaaicdacaGGSaaaaa@3D53@ y′=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E0A@ or 2y y 2 −2x =0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@424C@

A response need not state that at a horizontal tangent, y 2 −2x≠0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40C6@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point can be earned by presenting y 2 =2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DCC@ or y= 2x . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DCF@

The second point can be earned for the substitution of y= 2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CD4@ into 6x​y=2+ y 3 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4287@ or for substituting x= 2+ y 3 6y MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40DA@ into y 2 −2x=0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4044@

A response earns all three points by setting y 2 −2x=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4023@ declaring the point ( 1 2 ,1), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E17@ and verifying that this point is on the curve 6xy=2+ y 3 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@412E@

A response that identifies the point ( 1 2 ,1) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D67@ but does not verify that the point is on the curve, does not earn the second or the third point.

To earn the third point the response must present both coordinates of the point ( 1 2 ,1). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E19@ The coordinates need not appear as an ordered pair as long as they are labeled.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned by presenting one or more of the terms 6y dx dt , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA0@ 6x dy dt , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA0@ or 3 y 2 dy dt . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4093@

Units will not affect scoring in this part.

An unsupported response of − 8 9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BDC@ earns no points.

Alternate solution:

dy dt = dy dx ⋅ dx dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47FA@

dy dx   |  (x, y)=( 1 2 , −2) = 2(−2) (−2) 2 −2( 1 2 ) =− 4 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5EDA@

dy dt   |  (x, y)=( 1 2 , −2) = dy dx ⋅ dx dt   |  (x, y)=( 1 2 , −2) =− 4 3 ⋅ 2 3 =− 8 9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@761A@ unit per second

  • The first point is earned for the statement dy dt = dy dx ⋅ dx dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47FA@ or equivalent.

  • A numerical expression, such as − 4 3 ⋅ 2 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FE3@ or 2(−2) (−2) 2 −2( 1 2 ) ⋅ 2 3 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A85@ earns both points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
